page.title: 15Change-N.Wingfield 1945-85 A
page.content: {Landscape and Housing} Forty years ago wherever you lived in N.Wingfield,a colliery tip was in view but there were also green fields behind the ribbon development housing.This was mainly rows of terraced mine-workers' houses,with neither bathrooms nor running hot water and heated by coal.Most houses were overcrowded containing three generations.Post-war rented houses were replaced in 1952/3 by council housing(Whiteleas estate);old terraces were replaced in 1953 by the Alma estate(built by the NCB).In the 1960/70's,with the increase in home-ownership,private estates grew up behind the ribbon development.Now all houses have bathrooms, inside toilets and hot water.Many of the green fields are now housing estates and the colliery tips have gone.{J.D.Fisher.}
